author: Acrophis

text:
Man, this really sounds like it fits in the Galaxy universe for sure - live orchestra is freaking awesome!

At the opening of this track, it seems fairly standard, and rote, but man, when :40 comes around, those trumpets together feel like a vocalist coming in for an emotionally charged chorus, coming in on a swell of harmonics and a crash of cymbals.Pair that with the delayed roll-in of those strings singing, elevating the energy to a whole other level!....Man, this track is wonderfully addicting for that moment alone! Gorgeously orchestrated, though I do wish the almost hammer-dulcimer-esque percussion was more clean and distinct! Awesome, awesome song. <3
author: Tricaudae Studio

text: Supra, can I request "Sunshine Seaside"? ﻿
author: yuWIN

text:
Played through the whole thing recently and it is amazing!
Every level is unique and creative, the music is fantastic and the cat suit is the best power up since the racoon suit! The game is pure fun and keeps unlocking stuff over and over again! Place it with the new mario kart and nintendoland and you've got a realllly good reason to buy the wiiu ^_^

text:
I have to admit, even though this game is most likely yet another re-tread of the classic Mario formula, which is getting stale, I'm still kinda interested in buying this game. I'll have to put it in my wish list.

Also, the video image looks very similar to the final boss of Sonic Lost World.

author: Dalton McBleh

text: Currently the main reason I want to buy a Wii U in a couple months. I loved 3D Land and this looks/sounds even better. This particular theme was in 3D Land, but this remix makes it sound like it could fit right in a Galaxy game, great live instruments. Gotta love Yokota. I've been looking at some user screenshots and the graphics are superbly clean and appealing, I'm very glad to finally see some Nintendo HD action with the Wii U.
